scenarioDescription:
The xi Aql Exoplanetary System


Overview

xi Aql is a star with 2.2 times the mass of the Sun, and 12 times its radius. It is located 183.25 light years away from the solar system.

xi Aql is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the xi Aql system


xi Aql b

xi Aql b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory, in 2008-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.68 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of xi Aql b is 890.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of xi Aql b is 13.200 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, xi Aql b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system xi Aql, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
name: xi Aql - System With 1 Exoplanet
